name: Melia Golf Vichy Catalan

reviews.text: Overall this is a good place for a family holiday as the surrounding area offers plenty to do and the hotel was very kid-friendly. The accommodation was clean and comfortable with a contemporary feel. We managed to get interconnecting rooms on a last-minute booking which surprised me. The only shame was that the interconnecting rooms did not have a balcony so once we'd put the kids to bed, it was not possible to then sit outside on balcony for the rest of the evening. The breakfast was excellent, but for the price, only good value when included in the price of the room. The pool was comfortably big enough for those of us with younger children. The hotel staff and especially the front desk staff were fantastically helpful and kind.
reviews.title: Good Family -Friendly Hotel & Excellent Breakfast

likes.disliked: — No balcony in the inter-connectig rooms

reviews.text: Just got back this weekend. Firstly, the golf complex is no more than 10 mins in a taxi from Girona airport, brilliant, but costs around 25 euro one way. Here we go I thought....!
reviews.title: Golfing Break

reviews.text: The hotel itself is very well looked after (I think it's quite new anyway), staff very friendly. Rooms very clean and very comfy. We stayed B&B, and paid for the evening meal. Breakfast is v.good with many options. Our only gripe was we couldn't get lunch until after 1.30, but that was our own fault because we booked a tee off everyday at 1.00pm, so we missed lunch, and couldn't get anything to eat until both restaurants opened up at 8pm. In the evening there is an à la carte affair which we found a bit too much, and didn't really fill you, certainly wasn't worth the money, stick to the second restaurant next door for good old fries and a continental burger! We didn't get chance to venture out of the hotel and into Girona (only there for three days golf), but if you are playing golf in the morning etc, this is what I'd be tempted to do for dinner. But then the taxi in and out might cost you a bit.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - even if you aren't a golfer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alcohol is very expensive at the hotel - 5 euro for a Heineken (not the best beer), 12.5 euro for a "whiskey & coke" - so I was paying nearly £20 for two Jack Daniels & Coke - watch out for that! If you wanna drink beer, stick to their local CruzCampo stuff at 2.90 euro.
reviews.title: OK if you like the sound of dumper trucks
Group of golfers
reviews.text: PGA Catalunya (green course) is to die for, I'm a 17 handicap and found it quite a challenge, half the time I just took in the scenery! It's like hitting a golf ball off a carpet though, amazing. It was good just to play in the sun! The second course (red) is just as good, although not meant to be as challenging as the PGA. Get yourself a buggie with GPS, and you'll even catch the girl with a buggy loaded with beer somewhere around the course, the gps will let you know when she is near! ha!

Stayed here first in 2006 just after it opened, and the latest stay was in June 2010. The hotel grounds have matured in the meantime. The hotel overall - restaurant, rooms and other facilities - have maintained their high standards over the intervening years, which is normally a very good sign given the staff turnover issues in most hotels.
reviews.title: First rate, spacious hotel - Good for golfers or non-golfers

reviews.text: The only problem we had was with another guest trying to get into our room at 4.00 am, which, of course, had nothing to do with the hotel. But, the hotel's quality manager did discuss it with us, just in case it wasn't another guest - another good reassuring point in favour of the hotel.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a modern, quiet and very comfortable 4* hotel near to Girona, then you will find it hard to beat the Melia Golf.
reviews.title: Deluxe!! Very lucky to stay here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't say much about this hotel as I have stayed there only one night but my first feeling - beautiful and modern. Rooms are gorgeous and for the first time I've seen bathroom with so deep bath and window to the room - really looks very nice. Staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Most welcoming and friendly staff

reviews.text: We won a free two night stay and play at Melia Vichy/PGA Catalunya. We stayed in a Double Superior which was huge and beautiful, with a balcony facing the golf courses. The room was very clean and the bathroom was gorgeous. The only way to describe the room was deluxe! The housekeeping was very good. We had free access to the gym and spa, of which we used the spa and it was very nice. the receptionists were always very friendly. Also included in our stay was the buffet breakfast which was amazing. Everything was fresh and there were lots of choices both hot and cold, savoury and sweet. All staff that we came across were very friendly. We were very lucky to win this prize, and would definitly stay here again if it was in our budget!!!!!
reviews.title: Amazing rooms, awesome golf, expensive restaurant

likes.liked: — Location on the golf course, modern design

reviews.text: This hotel is new, therefore is it clean, the refurbishment is modern, all amenities that you expect are there. It is a nice location. Traveling with a rental car it was an ideal place to spend the night to catch an early flight back home from Girona airport.
reviews.title: Practical to stay if leaving from Girona airport

likes.disliked: — The noize of the garage door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was only one problem. Make sure you do not get a room at the front of the hotel. There is a garage door from the basement parking area that has a really loud and horribly noize which hurts the ears. It cracks and peeps as soon as the door opens. It is impossible to sleep. The door needs some oil or something.
reviews.title: excellent golf hotel

reviews.text: Anyhow, the staff was nice enough to change me to another room in the middle of the night. I understood I was not the first client to complain about this and got the room changed. Strangely enough it seems easier to change peoples location, than fix the problem.
reviews.title: Great place to go!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beside that, the location is really quiet.
reviews.title: Very nice, but needs polishing
